message.content:
cs.NI, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.AI 

This paper deals with a networking problem related to remote monitoring, which involves transmitting time-sensitive measurements. The problem involves minimizing a metric that maintains a trade-off between minimizing the sum of the expected Age of Information (AoI) of all sensors and minimizing an Ultra Reliable Low Latency Communication (URLLC) term. The paper proposes a low complexity reinforcement learning-based algorithm to solve the problem. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also involves the use of machine learning, specifically reinforcement learning, which makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely sub-category as well. The paper also deals with control and optimization, which makes cs.SY (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category. The paper also involves information theory, which makes cs.IT (Information Theory) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the development of a low complexity algorithm, which makes cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category.
